dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Sofia Vergara, forty-two point five million dollars. That is an absolutely staggering number for TV.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sofia Vergara, forty-two point five million dollars. That is an absolutely staggering number for T V.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 1. Sofia Vergara Earnings: $42.5 million Primary Show: Modern Family

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And it's, like, seventy-three percent more than Kaley Cuoco, who's in second place. That's a huge gap.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And it's, like, seventy-three percent more than Kaley Cuoco, who's in second place. That's a huge gap.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Her giant haul, which clocks in at 73% more than second-ranked Kaley Cuoco's $24.5 million, leads this year's ranking of the small screen's top earners.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's not just the Modern Family salary though, right? Almost half of that comes from endorsements and licensing deals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's not just the Modern Family salary though, right? Almost half of that comes from endorsements and licensing deals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Modern Family star reigns supreme thanks not only to her salary from her role on the hit ABC comedy but also to a slew of endorsements and lucrative licensing deals, which make up nearly half of her payday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, she's got that whole machine with her manager, Luis Balaguer. KitchenAid, West Elm... they're targeting the show's audience everywhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, she's got that whole machine with her manager, Luis Balaguer. KitchenAid, West Elm... they're targeting the show's audience everywhere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Among them: coffee maker SharkNinja Coffee and furniture chain Rooms To Go.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is a huge contrast to Cuoco, where ninety-five percent of her earnings are just from The Big Bang Theory.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is a huge contrast to Cuoco, where ninety-five percent of her earnings are just from The Big Bang Theory.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By contrast, 95% of Cuoco's earnings can be attributed to her role on Big Bang Theory.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And even then, she and the guys took a pay cut to bump up Melissa Rauch and Mayim Bialik's salaries. Down to eight hundred thousand an episode.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And even then, she and the guys took a pay cut to bump up Melissa Rauch and Mayim Bialik's salaries. Down to eight hundred thousand an episode.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Cuoco and her male co-stars took a pay cut, from an estimated $1 million an episode to $900,000 an episode, in an effort to free up cash for ranking newcomers Melissa Rauch (No. 6, $12 million) and Mayim Bialik (No. 6, $12 million).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still a pretty nice pay cut to be taking, honestly. Ellen Pompeo tied for second at twenty-three point five million, and she was very vocal about getting her piece of the Grey's Anatomy backend.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still a pretty nice pay cut to be taking, honestly. Ellen Pompeo tied for second at twenty-three point five million, and she was very vocal about getting her piece of the Grey's Anatomy backend.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Grey's Anatomy's Ellen Pompeo ($23.5 million) ranks third.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: As she should! She said when you help generate three billion dollars for a corporation, you start to feel like you deserve a share.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: As she should! She said when you help generate three billion dollars for a corporation, you start to feel like you deserve a share.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When your face and your voice have been part of something that's generated $3 billion for one of the biggest corporations in the world, you start to feel like, 'OK, maybe I do deserve a piece of this,' Pompeo told The Hollywood Reporter in January.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then you've got actresses like Mariska Hargitay and Julie Bowen who are making all their money just on screen, no endorsements.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then you've got actresses like Mariska Hargitay and Julie Bowen who are making all their money just on screen, no endorsements.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rounding out the top five are Law & Order: SVU's Mariska Hargitay (No. 4, $13 million) and Modern Family's Julie Bowen (No. 5, $12.5 million). Both forgo endorsements and instead make their cash on screen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting to see the different strategies. But overall, uh, the top ten combined pulled in a hundred and sixty-eight point five million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting to see the different strategies. But overall, uh, the top ten combined pulled in a hundred and sixty-eight point five million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Together, the world's 10 highest-paid TV actresses earned a combined $168.5 million between June 1, 2017, and June 1, 2018, up from $156.5 million in the same period last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Up from last year, too. Claire Danes is back on the list after a few years, which is cool.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Up from last year, too. Claire Danes is back on the list after a few years, which is cool.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Returning to the ranking is Homeland's Claire Danes (No. 9, $9 million), who last appeared on the list in 2014.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And only two newcomers this time, both from Big Bang Theory. A real changing of the guard for some shows.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And only two newcomers this time, both from Big Bang Theory. A real changing of the guard for some shows.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rauch and Bialik are the only newcomers this year.

artist_script:
HostA: Sofia Vergara, forty-two point five million dollars. That is an absolutely staggering number for TV.
HostB: Right? And it's, like, seventy-three percent more than Kaley Cuoco, who's in second place. That's a huge gap.
HostA: It's not just the Modern Family salary though, right? Almost half of that comes from endorsements and licensing deals.
HostB: Yeah, she's got that whole machine with her manager, Luis Balaguer. KitchenAid, West Elm... they're targeting the show's audience everywhere.
HostA: Which is a huge contrast to Cuoco, where ninety-five percent of her earnings are just from The Big Bang Theory.
HostB: And even then, she and the guys took a pay cut to bump up Melissa Rauch and Mayim Bialik's salaries. Down to eight hundred thousand an episode.
HostA: Still a pretty nice pay cut to be taking, honestly. Ellen Pompeo tied for second at twenty-three point five million, and she was very vocal about getting her piece of the Grey's Anatomy backend.
HostB: As she should! She said when you help generate three billion dollars for a corporation, you start to feel like you deserve a share.
HostA: And then you've got actresses like Mariska Hargitay and Julie Bowen who are making all their money just on screen, no endorsements.
HostB: It's interesting to see the different strategies. But overall, uh, the top ten combined pulled in a hundred and sixty-eight point five million.
HostA: Up from last year, too. Claire Danes is back on the list after a few years, which is cool.
HostB: And only two newcomers this time, both from Big Bang Theory. A real changing of the guard for some shows.
